Rule.Name: ToStringMustNotBeCalledForStringObjects
Rule.Description: Calling the ToString-Method for a string does make no sense. It only generates memory stress by allocating a new buffer for the string.

Rule.Name: ReturnValuesOfStringMethodsMustBeInterpreted
Rule.Description: The return value of any String-Method must be processed by code.
Rule.Resolution: Remove the call to the method, because it only produces a return value that is discarded.
